required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pilot Trial of Acute N-Acetylcysteine Effects on Working Memory and Other Cognitive Functions in Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Trial of Acute N-Acetylcysteine Effects on Working Memory and Other Cognitive Functions in Schizophrenia

collaborator.agency: National Alliance for Research on Schizophrenia and Depression

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effects of the amino acid supplement N-Acetylcysteine versus placebo on working memory and other cognitive functions in persons with a diagnosis of schizophrenia.

detailed_description.textblock: Working memory impairment in Schizophrenia is produced by deficiencies of feedback inhibition of glutamate release, due to low cysteine-glutamate antiporter activity. Because of this mechanism, we are interested in whether acute administration of N-Acetylcysteine will improve performance of patients with schizophrenia on a battery of cognitive tasks utilized to test working memory and other cognitive domains, versus placebo. This pilot study will utilize a randomized, double blind, placebo controlled, crossover design.

primary_outcome.description: The Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia (BACS) is an instrument that assesses the aspects of cognition found to be most impaired and most strongly correlated with outcome in patients with schizophrenia. The BACS composite raw score the total of the raw scores for the 6 subtests of the BACS (Verbal memory, token motor, digit sequencing, verbal fluency, symbol coding and executive functioning). The range, so we could be from 0-435. A high score total score is more favorable and indicates a higher level of cognition. The BACS requires less than 35 min to complete in patients with schizophrenia, yields a high completion rate in these patients, and has high reliability. The BACS was found to be as sensitive to cognitive impairment in patients with schizophrenia as a standard battery of tests that required over 2 h to administer. It is the raw sum of the test items and higher scores are favorable.

The BACS requires less than 35 min to complete in patients with schizophrenia, yields a high completion rate in these patients, and has high reliability. The BACS was found to be as sensitive to cognitive impairment in patients with schizophrenia as a standard battery of tests that required over 2 h to administer. It is the raw sum of the test items and higher scores are favorable.

secondary_outcome.measure: Letter/Number Sequencing Task Tests for Attention, Concentration & Mental Control (LNS) RAW SCORE.
secondary_outcome.description: Letter Number Sequencing (LNS) is a brief, standardized executive function task used to assess verbal working memory performance. The test involves a 24-item Experimental Condition, in which participants are read a series of letters and numbers and asked to recite both back in ascending order, with the numbers first and then the letters. Participants receive one point for each correct answer for a range of 0-24. Higher scores are better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Brief Visuospatial Memory Test (BVMT) RAW SCORE.
secondary_outcome.description: Brief Visuospatial Memory Test (BVMT) is a measure of visuospatial memory. This task includes three trials of six geometric figures printed in a 2 x 3 array on separate pages. The respondent views the stimulus page for 10 seconds and is asked to draw as many of the figures as possible in their correct location on a page in the response booklet. A Delayed Recall Trial is administered after a 25-minute delay. Scoring is based on accuracy of the figure as well as its location on the page. A range of 0-12 per trial is possible(0-36 total). Higher scores are better.

secondary_outcome.measure: Brief Visuospatial Memory Test (BVMT) RAW SCORE.

Higher scores are better.

Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) utilized before and after treatment. BPRS total score is a total of the 18 item scores with a range of 18-126. It is used to measure schizophrenia symptoms and to assess change in them over time. There are 18 symptom sub scores. Each symptom is rated 1-7 (not present to extremely severe) and then all items are summed for the total score. Higher scores indicate more severe symptoms. The BPRS is the gold-standard overall measure of schizophrenia symptoms which will be utilized to demonstrate that the intervention does not cause worsening of the illness symptoms apart from the usual fluctuations of the natural course.

Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) utilized before and after treatment. BPRS total score is a total of the 18 item scores with a range of 18-126. It is used to measure schizophrenia symptoms and to assess change in them over time. There are 18 symptom sub scores. Each symptom is rated 1-7 (not present to extremely severe) and then all items are summed for the total score. Higher scores indicate more severe symptoms. The BPRS is the gold-standard overall measure of schizophrenia symptoms which will be utilized to demonstrate that the intervention does not cause worsening of the illness symptoms apart from the usual fluctuations of the natural course.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from PreScreening at End of Trial
secondary_outcome.description: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) utilized before and after treatment. BPRS total score is a total of the 18 item scores with a range of 18-126. It is used to measure schizophrenia symptoms and to assess change in them over time. There are 18 symptom sub scores. Each symptom is rated 1-7 (not present to extremely severe) and then all items are summed for the total score. Higher scores indicate more severe symptoms. The BPRS is the gold-standard overall measure of schizophrenia symptoms which will be utilized to demonstrate that the intervention does not cause worsening of the illness symptoms apart from the usual fluctuations of the natural course.

arm_group.description: Group A first receives the commercially available sustained release form of N-acetylcysteine, then the matching placebo capsules both administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days (8 total doses over 5 days).

Group B first receives the placebo and then receives a commercially available sustained release form of N-Acetylcysteine. In each arm, the capsules are both administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days (8 total doses over 5 days).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects will be between 18-60
- Meet Diagnostic and Statistical Manual-IV (DSM) criteria for schizophrenia
- Be on a stable dose of antipsychotic medication for at least 1 month
- Be deemed clinically stable for 3 months by the regular clinical staff
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current substance or alcohol abuse
- Pregnancy
- Clozapine treatment
- Known sensitivity to sulphur containing compounds
- Previous diagnosis of mental retardation
- Nitroglycerin use
- Asthma diagnosis, verified and treated by a primary care doctor
- Use of any other medication that may interact with the study medication

group.title: Group A: NAC 1st Trial, Placebo 2nd Trial
group.description: Group A first receives the commercially available sustained release form of NAC, then the matching placebo capsules both administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days (8 total doses over 5 days).

group.title: Group B: Placebo 1st Trial, NAC 2nd Trial
group.description: Group B first receives the matching placebo capsules both administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days , then receives commercially available sustained release form of NAC for the same period (8 total doses over 5 days).

group.title: Participants
group.description: This is the overall group of trial participants prior to randomization to either of the two crossover arms in the study.

Gender

outcome.title: BACS Composite RAW Score
outcome.description: The Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia (BACS) is an instrument that assesses the aspects of cognition found to be most impaired and most strongly correlated with outcome in patients with schizophrenia. The BACS composite raw score the total of the raw scores for the 6 subtests of the BACS (Verbal memory, token motor, digit sequencing, verbal fluency, symbol coding and executive functioning). The range, so we could be from 0-435. A high score total score is more favorable and indicates a higher level of cognition. The BACS requires less than 35 min to complete in patients with schizophrenia, yields a high completion rate in these patients, and has high reliability. The BACS was found to be as sensitive to cognitive impairment in patients with schizophrenia as a standard battery of tests that required over 2 h to administer. It is the raw sum of the test items and higher scores are favorable.
outcome.population: Subjects analyzed are those with complete data at baseline prior to dropout from the study.

outcome.title: Letter/Number Sequencing Task Tests for Attention, Concentration & Mental Control (LNS) RAW SCORE.
outcome.description: Letter Number Sequencing (LNS) is a brief, standardized executive function task used to assess verbal working memory performance. The test involves a 24-item Experimental Condition, in which participants are read a series of letters and numbers and asked to recite both back in ascending order, with the numbers first and then the letters. Participants receive one point for each correct answer for a range of 0-24. Higher scores are better.
outcome.population: All participants were analyzed that had baseline data collected (including any that did not complete the time frame).

outcome.population: Subjects analyzed are those with complete data at follow up and does not include those that had dropped from the study.

group.title: Intervention
group.description: This is the combined intervention group (both those receiving the intervention first and those receiving the intervention second).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: This is the combined placebo/control group (both those receiving the placebo first and those receiving the placebo second).

measure.title: Letter/Number Sequencing Task Tests for Attention, Concentration & Mental Control (LNS) RAW SCORE.
measure.description: Letter Number Sequencing (LNS) is a brief, standardized executive function task used to assess verbal working memory performance. The test involves a 24-item Experimental Condition, in which participants are read a series of letters and numbers and asked to recite both back in ascending order, with the numbers first and then the letters. Participants receive one point for each correct answer for a range of 0-24. Higher scores are better.
measure.population: Subjects analyzed are those with complete data at follow up and does not include those that had dropped from the study.

outcome.title: Letter/Number Sequencing Task Tests for Attention, Concentration & Mental Control (LNS) RAW SCORE.
outcome.description: Letter Number Sequencing (LNS) is a brief, standardized executive function task used to assess verbal working memory performance. The test involves a 24-item Experimental Condition, in which participants are read a series of letters and numbers and asked to recite both back in ascending order, with the numbers first and then the letters. Participants receive one point for each correct answer for a range of 0-24. Higher scores are better.
outcome.population: Subjects analyzed are those with complete data at baseline prior to dropout from the study.

group.title: Group A: NAC 1st Trial, Placebo 2nd Trial
group.description: Group A first receives the commercially available sustained release form of NAC, then the matching placebo capsules both administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days (8 total doses over 5 days.

group.title: Group B: Placebo 1st Trial, NAC 2nd Trial
group.description: Group B first receives the placebo and then receives the commercially available sustained release form of NAC. Both are administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days (8 total doses over 5 days).

group.title: Group B: Placebo 1st Trial, NAC 2nd Trial
group.description: Group B first receives the placebo and then receives the commercially available sustained release form of NAC. Both are administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days (8 total doses over 5 days).

measure.title: Letter/Number Sequencing Task Tests for Attention, Concentration & Mental Control (LNS) RAW SCORE.
measure.description: Letter Number Sequencing (LNS) is a brief, standardized executive function task used to assess verbal working memory performance. The test involves a 24-item Experimental Condition, in which participants are read a series of letters and numbers and asked to recite both back in ascending order, with the numbers first and then the letters. Participants receive one point for each correct answer for a range of 0-24. Higher scores are better.
measure.population: Subjects analyzed are those with complete data at 2nd follow up in the crossover and does not include those that had dropped from the study.

outcome.title: Brief Visuospatial Memory Test (BVMT) RAW SCORE.
outcome.description: Brief Visuospatial Memory Test (BVMT) is a measure of visuospatial memory. This task includes three trials of six geometric figures printed in a 2 x 3 array on separate pages. The respondent views the stimulus page for 10 seconds and is asked to draw as many of the figures as possible in their correct location on a page in the response booklet. A Delayed Recall Trial is administered after a 25-minute delay. Scoring is based on accuracy of the figure as well as its location on the page. A range of 0-12 per trial is possible(0-36 total). Higher scores are better.
outcome.population: All participants were analyzed that had baseline data collected (including any that did not complete the time frame).

group.description: This is the combined intervention group (both those receiving the intervention first and those receiving the intervention second).

group.title: Placebo

measure.title: Brief Visuospatial Memory Test (BVMT) RAW SCORE.
measure.description: Brief Visuospatial Memory Test (BVMT) is a measure of visuospatial memory. This task includes three trials of six geometric figures printed in a 2 x 3 array on separate pages. measure.population: Subjects analyzed are those with complete data at follow up in the crossover and does not include those that had dropped from the study.

outcome.title: BACS Composite RAW Score
outcome.description: The Brief Assessment of Cognition in Schizophrenia (BACS) is an instrument that assesses the aspects of cognition found to be most impaired and most strongly correlated with outcome in patients with schizophrenia. The BACS composite raw score the total of the raw scores for the 6 subtests of the BACS (Verbal memory, token motor, digit sequencing, verbal fluency, symbol coding and executive functioning). The range, so we could be from 0-435. A high score total score is more favorable and indicates a higher level of cognition. The BACS requires less than 35 min to complete in patients with schizophrenia, yields a high completion rate in these patients, and has high reliability. The BACS was found to be as sensitive to cognitive impairment in patients with schizophrenia as a standard battery of tests that required over 2 h to administer. It is the raw sum of the test items and higher scores are favorable.
outcome.time_frame: Follow Up 1st Leg of Crossover (5 Days)
outcome.population: Per protocol

outcome.title: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS)Total Score
outcome.description: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) utilized before and after treatment. BPRS total score is a total of the 18 item scores with a range of 18-126. It is used to measure schizophrenia symptoms and to assess change in them over time. There are 18 symptom sub scores. Each symptom is rated 1-7 (not present to extremely severe) and then all items are summed for the total score. Higher scores indicate more severe symptoms. The BPRS is the gold-standard overall measure of schizophrenia symptoms which will be utilized to demonstrate that the intervention does not cause worsening of the illness symptoms apart from the usual fluctuations of the natural course.
outcome.population: Per protocol

group.title: Group A: NAC 1st Trial, Placebo 2nd Trial
group.description: Group A first receives the commercially available sustained release form of NAC, then the matching placebo capsules both administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days (8 total doses over 5 days).

group.title: Group B: Placebo 1st Trial, NAC 2nd Trial
group.description: Group B first receives the matching placebo capsules both administered at 1200mg twice a day for 3 full days, along with 1200mg once on the evening prior to and once on the morning following the 3 days , then receives commercially available sustained release form of NAC for the same period (8 total doses over 5 days).

measure.title: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS)Total Score
measure.description: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) utilized before and after treatment. BPRS total score is a total of the 18 item scores with a range of 18-126. It is used to measure schizophrenia symptoms and to assess change in them over time. There are 18 symptom sub scores. Each symptom is rated 1-7 (not present to extremely severe) and then all items are summed for the total score. Higher scores indicate more severe symptoms. The BPRS is the gold-standard overall measure of schizophrenia symptoms which will be utilized to demonstrate that the intervention does not cause worsening of the illness symptoms apart from the usual fluctuations of the natural course.
measure.population: Per protocol

outcome.title: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS)Total Score
outcome.description: Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS) utilized before and after treatment. BPRS total score is a total of the 18 item scores with a range of 18-126. The BPRS is the gold-standard overall measure of schizophrenia symptoms which will be utilized to demonstrate that the intervention does not cause worsening of the illness symptoms apart from the usual fluctuations of the natural course.
outcome.population: Per protocol

outcome.time_frame: Change from PreScreening at End of Trial
outcome.population: Analyses only used matched cases and does not include participants with incomplete data.

group.title: Placebo: First Crossover Follow Up
group.description: This group of participants received the placebo on the first day in the crossover design.

group.title: NAC: First Crossover Follow Up
group.description: This group of participants received the active treatment (NAC) on the first day of the crossover study.

group.title: Placebo: Second Crossover Follow Up
group.description: This group of participants received the placebo on the second day in the crossover design.

group.title: NAC: Second Crossover Follow Up
group.description: This group of participants received the active treatment (NAC) on the second day of the crossover study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Cenk Tek MD, Associate Professor of Psychiatry; Director, Psychosis Program, CMHC
point_of_contact.organization: Yale University School of Medicine, Department of Psychiatry
